text:
(Les Trois Mousquetaires S.S. Hopfenweisse) Bottle 375ml at home, serve into a shaker, ABV 6%
Golden orange colour on the body, clear, with lots of activity in the glass.
Good sized and thuck white head on top.
Aroma of wheat, floral notes, peach marmalade.
Taste has wheat, again some floral notes, marmalade, malts, with a mildly bitter finish.
Medium thin body.
Decent.

750ml bottle. Pours a cloudy gold-orange with a large, frothy, long lasting, white head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet aroma of wheat malt, grass, yeast, herbal and banana. Sweet flavour of wheat malt, banana, yeast, mango, papaya and herbal with a dry, hoppy, bitter grass finish. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. Very tasty, an excellent wheat ale.
couleur blonde trouble. gout léger mais à lamertume profonde aux relents herbacés.

Dorada anaranjada, consistentemente turbia. Aroma interesante, entre frutal, con notas cítricas y platano, y lactea. En boca se sale de lo típico, posiblemente debido a un innegable fondo salado, y una mezcla razonablemente equilibrada de sabores frutales, los del aroma, y toques ácidos. Mas seca y amarga que dulce, pero tiene de todo. Interesante.

 [ Aspecto ] De un brillante color dorado ambarino y una transparencia sorprende para ser una cerveza de trigo. Espuma blanca y abundante de cremosidad media, burbuja pequeña, persistencia media y alta adherencia, dejando un bonito encaje de Bruselas.
  [ En nariz ] Intensidad media-alta en nariz, con predominancia de los aromas afrutados sobre una base cítrica y un fondo lejano de flores blancas. Con una complejidad media, el plátano predomina por encima de todo, aunque de forma muy equilibrada y muy muy agradable. La base cítrica ayuda mucho en ese equilibrio y buen aroma.
  [ En boca ] En cuanto a los cuatro gustos básicos (dulce, salado, ácido y amargo; dejamos ahora de lado el umami), el dulzor predomina de inicio, sin ser nunca dulzón, y con un punto salado muy de fondo. A continuación y enseguida aparece un amargor ligero pero muy evidente que desplaza paulatinamente al dulzor inicial. De cuerpo medio, la sensación en boca es cremosa, claramente frisante y casi "crujiente". Muy refrescante en todo caso. En cuanto al retronasal y la evolución en boca, se mueve de forma clara desde el dulzor inicial a un amargor tan suave como evidente. Un equilibrio dinámico entre estos dos sabores básicos que resulta extremadamente agradable. Persistencia en boca muy larga.
  [ Consideraciones generales y Maridaje ] De trago largo y gran bebestibilidad, su característico amargor la hace absolutamente recomendable para aperitivo. También va muy bien con carnes (excepto de caza) y con quesos de todo tipo, aunque problemente de manera especial con quesos holandeses y otros de fondo dulce; también marida perfectamente con parmesano.
  [ Opinión personal tras la cata de la LTM Hopfenweisse ] Una hefeweizen (o kristallweizen, diría yo) muy original e interesante. El amargor está perfectamente equilibrado y le da una gracia y atractivo especial. Sin duda repetiré cuando tenga oportunidad.
Apparence trouble, mais un arôme mielleux, citronné, tout comme au goût, en y ajoutant un petit quelque chose dherbacé. Ce nest pas une bière qui ma fait tombée de ma chaise malgré tout.

11-12-16 // bottle at home. Pours a cloudy ornage coloured beer. Light hoppy nose. Taste is loads a wheat, some banana, some yeast,a bit soapy. Good hop flavors in the end, some herbal notes along some tropical fruits. Enjoyed it.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Pours slightly hazy light amber with a medium but stable foam. Aroma is nicely floral with some hints of citrus, hoppy indeed. Medium body with a light carbonation to support the tropical fruity flavours. Leads into a fruity and slightly bitter, yet rather short finish on the palate. Juicy and tasty. Yum!

0.375l bottle. Hazy golden body with a lasting white head. Aroma of bread, mango, lemon zest, cloves, grass and medicinal hops. Taste of bread, lemon zest, banana, mango, citruses and medicinal hops. The description is proper in that its really like a mixture of a German wheat beer and an APA. I like it.

Pours a golden clearish color with a small white head. Fruity nose. Banana notes, cloves, citrus notes, funky lemon and other tropical fruits. You get a bit of cereal, wheat aroma as well. Pretty sweet taste but not really overpowering. palate is kind of sticky a bit. You get a nice medium hops finish with tons of flavors going through. This is really nice. Decent carbonation.

bottle(2015). Poured hazy amber with an overactive carbonated white head. Aroma is spicy, hint of pear. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, tart finish. Complex flavour, pale malt, spicy notes of clove and pepper, citrus peel and bananas, slight yeast.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - pretty clear dark blond beer under a solid long lasting white foam; quite hoppy with notes of ripe fruits and honey; full-bodied, sweet and very tasty, lively palate; light chewy and sticky; bitter finish with residual sugars and more ripe fruits and spicy hops - superb

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 very hazy yellow colour, moderate sized dense white head; aroma of intensive tropical fruits, some citruses and banana, hints of caramel and wet wheat; taste is a perfect mixture of a great weizen and a tropical fruity IPA with hop dominance; although not as good as the perfect Schneider Meine Hopfen-Weisse, still extremely enjoyable!
Hazy yellow colour with thin head. Aroma and flavour have plenty of hop. Well balanced and nicely bitter.

Apparence : Dorée, reflets jaunes, assez trouble, beau col blanc avec une rétention moyenne et laissant une dentelle, effervescence moyenne.

Nez : Rustique, citron, orange, tropical. 

Goût : Moyennement sucrée (miel), citron, un peu résine et rustique, finale sèche et herbacée. Amertume balancée.

Sensation : Corps moyen, huileuse, bonne longueur, légère chaleur en gorge. 

Bref : Bonne bière se rapprochant beaucoup plus de la IPA que de la Weizen. Le houblonnage est intéressant, mais on y perd à mon goût les saveurs peut-être plus délicates de la levure allemande (banane et clou de girofle). Tout de même très bien faite.
Bottle. Hazy dark gold color. Thin white head. Light sweet, medium bitter. Aroma is herby, caramel, hoppy, citric. A bit grassy.

Refrigerated 75cl brown bottle corked and capped poured into a weizen glass. Cloudy light orange with small white head. Aroma is minty/herbal hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is herbal hops, mango hops, some minty hops, and slightly bitter finish. Different beer.

500ml bottle from 100 Beers in Sofia. Clear golden-orange color with a lasting two-finger white head and good lacing. The aroma is hoppy, wheaty, herbal, and tropical. Pineapple, mango, banana, papaya evident. The flavor is fairly dry and crisp. Slightly bitter on the finish. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Really great for the wheat ale style.

Pours a hazy golden color with medium to high white head. Aroma has banana and spices, but also citruciness and a marked floral character. Taste follows the aroma, banana and spicy notes, followed by a good kick of citrusy hoppiness, with a good bready/biscuity backbone, finishing with a moderate bitterness.
Hazy golden color with nice white head. Banana and some spices in the aroma. Same in the taste, with some hoppy hint. Very drinkable.
Bottle. Hazy yellow-orange colour with white head. Wheat, banana aroma. Sweet, wheat, banana, fruity, bitter taste. Medium body. Not hoppy, probably it was old.
Great hopfenweisse. Hops, citrus and bitterness in the start and sweet banany finish. Aroma totaly matches the taste. Big fan!

750ml bottle. Golden yellow in colour with a large and long lasting white head, excellent lacing. The aroma is lightly hoppy, some grass, yeast, bready. The flavour is of grassy hops, yeast, some bananas, wheat. Lightly bitter mouthfeel, medium/light body, moderate carbonation. Finishes long, yeasty, some bitterness. Another very good beer from this brewery, very refreshing.

Something fishy golden color with white foam and thin loop. On the nose notes of wheat, banana, pine and slightly spicy. The taste is moderately bitter and sweet so the balance is quite good, offers flavors wheat first, then citrus and overall hop with herbal nuances, papaya, mango and banana. The body is medium and so is the carbonation. Made with hops Summit.

Veiled golden color with some powerful activity. Foamy, almost creamy, white 2 finger head lasting around 10 minutes with some strong legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, fruits, grains, floral and herbal spices. Well intensified taste of sweet orange, banana, mango and having a pleasant lemony and grainy sharpness with a rich floral hops feel and saaz spiciness.

Slick medium body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced finish ending with sensations of smoky orange peel or clove and a slightly grassy feel.

Overall : Great craft with delicious complex flavors, well balanced and intensified with a crisp freshness. The only drawback is it feels more like an IPA than a hefeweizen...but not really a flaw.
Les arômes du houblon et de la levure allemande sont très invitants au nez. Par contre, je ne suis pas certain du mélange en bouche. Certainement pas mon style de bière préféré.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2016 Bottle, bottled 03.2015  (from Saveur Biere). Pours golden with white head. The head stays. Aroma is very sweet, vanilla, banana, citrus, herbs. Flavor is sweet and bitter, spices and herbs, banana, mango, pine, black pepper. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: good, but would like to try fresher sample.
375ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.fr. Pours hazy gold, good white head. Aroma is good weiss yeast esters. Taste is lovely and smooth with good banana / vanilla flavours and slight pillowy mouthfeel.
Bottle from Beer Cartel 231015. Thick looking beer with a big ice cream head. Murky and hazy in the glass with banana aroma. Heavy in the glass with a thick mouthfeel.

Dégustée en accompagnement dun steak de thon avec Mademoiselle Irina. De mon verre émanent des arômes tropicales et fruités de banane,fruit de la passion et mangue. Beaucoup de blé également qui occupe ici une place prépondérante. Texture un peu lourde qui était prévisible de par la densité visible du liquide lorsque je fais tournoyer celui-ci dans mon verre. Saveurs douces, très granuleuses aux houblons absents malgré le dry hop décrit sur létiquette. Longue en bouche, très ou trop sucrée pour moi et saveurs persistantes qui reprennent les arômes annoncés. Une excellente représentante de ce style au Québec!

Bottle from State Line, shared at a tasting. Hazy orange, thin fizzy head, poor head retention. Aroma of wheat, caramel, yeast, banana. The taste is yeast, floral hops, citrus, wheat, spice. Medium-full bodied, lingering spice.

Pours a hazy golden topped by a finger of frothy off-white head showing good retention and lacing properties. Vivid carbonation spotted through the glass. The nose is hoppy with grapefruit. Very strong floral elements almost reminiscent of a pseudomonas (philadelphius coronarius). Some bready malts come through. The taste is dominated by grapefruit. Very sharp and grassy, almost woody. Medium body with a moderately lingering finish. Great pairing with strong and sharp cheeses. Cheers!
Bottle 33,5 CL. Pours hazy yellow with white lacing head. Notes of perfume,, citrus. Pretty good.- beerbasher
Bottle. Yellow golden, hazy. Floral, perfumy estery nose. Green fine citrus herbs, banana. Med bodied, dry finish. Pretty nice, super flavourful.-- bb
Pale hazy golden beer, with thin white head. Taste citrous with some mature fruit. More a pale ale than weissbier.

Hazy golden colour, with an extremely active white head. Carbonation bubbles rise quickly. The nose has pineapple hops, maybe a bit of mango, and some wheat characteristics.
Mildly bitter hop citrus on the tongue with some very light banana on the back end.
Definitely one of the best beers Ive enjoyed in the style.
Hazy yellow beer with a long lasting thick white head. Aroma of veggies, garden hops. Herbal flavour, mild bitterness, grapefruit. Long aftertaste, medium bodied and very refreshing. Well done.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, wheat, Belgian yeast and spices. Taste is moderately sweet with mild bitterness. Flavors of banana, Belgian yeast and wheat. Some tropical fruit flavors and maybe a little citrus fruit as well. Medium bodied and very refreshing. Excellent wheat beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pretty decent beer. Refreshing on a hot summer day. I wish I had another one for right now.

Robe dun blond pâle très trouble, aucun col de mousse, dentelle inexistante. Arômes de pamplemousse, zeste de citron, grains de céréales, banane, orange et blé malté sucré. En bouche, pamplemousse et grains dominent. Suivent des effluves de citron, banane et lamertume de pamplemousse ne décolle pas. La finale goûte le gros grain de céréale bien frais. Un peu déçu de ne pas percevoir le côté soyeux de la blanche allemande mais le bon côté houblonné et de céréale compensent cette lacune. Texture modérée, bonne effervescence et les saveurs sont très bien balancées. La meilleure hopfenweiss fait au Québec personnellement.

Nez vif de zestes dagrumes et de banane Col épais de mousse. Robe voilée dun jaune orangée. Goût qui foudroie en bouche par son amertume qui se dissipe vite en laissant tout de même une fin légèrement amère. Goût herbeux, boisé avec un soupçon de papaye. Intéressante. Mais je nen prendrais pas une deuxième.

Bière blanche réunissant les saveurs des Weizen dAllemagne et les houblons typiques américains. Saveurs: herbacée/ papaye/ mangue/ banane. Houblonnée à froid au houblon Summit. Wheat ale mixing the flavors of Germanys Weizen and Americas typical hops. Flavors: herbal/ papaya/ mango/ banana. Dry-hopped with Summit hops.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of banana and maybe some other fruit, very nice on the nose. Pours a hazy golden with white head that leaves some lacing. Taste is light sour. Medium body, creamy texture, with a dry finish. A really nice brew, would be excellent for a hot day.
750 mL bottle. hazy gold-straw colored pour with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, clove, yeast, spice. Similar taste. Very well made!

750 ml bottle, 3 months old. Nose is citrus, mango, funky yeast, herbs, very nice. Taste is hoppy, citrus pine, barely a hint of banana. Hops dominate here, not much in the way of traditional wheat beer flavours. Drinks like an American pale ale to me. Nice, crisp and hoppy.
Orange, hazy, medium head. Hoppy-sour aroma: citrus, orange and spices in it. Hoppy-malty-well balanced taste. Bitter-fizzy finish :) Full body with a sour, refreshing tinge at the end.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with small white head. Aroma of spices and banana. Real nice. Would drink again.

Pours a hazy light golden with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of wheat, banana, pine and ends with some light cloves spiciness. Taste is moderately bitter and sweet so balance is pretty good, offers flavors of wheat first, then citrus and just generally hoppy. Body is medium and so is carbonation (maybe a touch over medium in fact) and feels like a wheat beer. Well done, Trois Mousquetaires, well done.

Bottle bought directly from the brewery. Thanks Guillaume. Aroma: mango, banana, wheat, spices. App: hazy golden with small white head. Taste and palate: full body, light sweetness, long light bitter finish. Overall: really good Hopfenweisse!

Brown bottle, 750 ml, trade with Alex Ganivet-Boileau (merci!), produced on 8/12/2013, best before 8/12/2014, savoured on December 20 2014; eye: orangey, slightly hazy, average effervescence, ring of white head made up of rather large bubbles, light lacing; nose: tangerine, tropical fruits, perfumy hops; mouth: tropical fruits, hops, acidity, herbaceous, perfumy, semi-dry finale in hops with presence of tropical fruits, medium body, quite carbonated, lightly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, produite le 8/12/2013, meilleure avant 8/12/2014, échange avec Alex Ganivet-Boileau (merci!), savourée le 18 décembre 2014; il : orangée, très légèrement voilée, effervescence moyenne, anneau de mousse blanche formée de bulles plutôt grosses, légère dentelle; nez : tangerine, fruits tropicaux, houblon parfumé; bouche : fruits tropicaux, houblon, acidité, herbacée, parfumé, finale semi-sèche en houblon avec présence de fruits tropicaux, corps moyen, pas mal carbonatée, curieusement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien

Bière jaune paille, légèrement voilée, coiffée dune mousse généreuse. Nez tout en agrumes, en fruits tropicaux et en houblons, un peu comme une IPA. Très fruité et invitant. En bouche, cest tranchant et goûteux. Aux levures allemandes se mêlent les notes herbacées des houblons et les notes dananas, ce qui crée limpression davoir un mélange de blanche et de india pale ale. Les amateurs de blanches belges seront un peu pantois peut-être, mais si vous aimez les bières amères, vous risquez dapprécier cette blanche surprenante. Cheers!
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with a white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, pine, orange. Flavour is hop, orange, pine, wheat, banana, orange. Medium body. OK beer.

Hooooo-boy! Where has this brew been all my life? If ever there was a beer to convert the North American palate to a European style this would be it. From a beautiful package of very slightly hazy blondness with a bold white head comes sumptuous smells of pineapple, mango, papaya, banana, grass, bubblegum, honey and wheat. You might think that the aforementioned scents would give way to a cloying quaff but upon first sip youll find a very balanced brew, even finishing a bit bitterer than anticipated. This fantastic brew has a good chew to it and a mid-soft carbonation. Damn fine.

Pours cloudy pale to medium gold with one finger of loose white head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, moderate lacing. (3/5) Nose is yeasty wheat, banana, citrus and herbal. (7/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderate bitter, slight sour, peppery spice. (7/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, crisp finish. (4/5)

A decent hefeweizen, if a bit on the strong and emphatic side for the style. The yeasty wheat is given a run for its money by the circusy and herbal dry hopping. Theres a little lactic sourness that helps the moderate carbonation provide a crisp finish, along with the building peppery spice notes. The moderately high ABV never makes an appearance. (15/20)

375ml bottle. Hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors are wheat, banana, herbs, grapefruit peel, spices and tropical fruits with minty and floral notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Pours clear straw with little frothy head. Aroma is wheat, basement, and herbs. Tastes of bubblegum, banana, papaya, and herbs. Has a medium body with lively carbonation. Very refreshing despite all that bubblegum.

Pour is hazy yellow with a thin but persisten white head. Nose is banana, citrus, tropical fruits and cloves with a hint of lactic sourness. Taste is the same with a medium bitterness that evolves towards the end. Citrus and slightly piney hops. Smooth mouthfeel. Good representation of the style!

375 mml bottle tasted on the 22/10/2014. Hazy golden colour with a tiny white head. Aroma of citrus, malts and herbs. The taste is fruity (mango and banana),wheaty and malty. Aftertastes is sweet but not intense. Next one please!

Where and how:  bottle 375 ml 
Aroma plenty of wheat up font. Citrusy hop notes. Touch of clove, mild hint of black pepper. 7+.
 Appearance : 
Top: large, almost gushing. Fine, bright white top.
Base: murky, hazy gold.
Palate : fairly dry, mid lighter body.
Taste: refreshing, crisp with nice hop side to it.
 Other notes  very nice.

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Mondial/Mulhouse - SO. Lusciously dryhopped, zippy North-American wheat ale/Weizen approximation with zesty aromas of fresh lime peel and papaya-vanilla merengue. Taste has that slightly chemical New World Weizen unfocussed yeastiness going on, played over by a pleasant tartness. Obviously modeled after Schneider Weisses pioneering TAP4-5 experiments with dryhopping and enjoyable in its own right.

This beer had some of the grossest-looking sediment Ive ever seen, floating around like big clumps of grey algae. That being said its fairly pretty once it settles. Nose is typical banana/cloves, with a teeny tiny hint of the tropical fruit mentioned on the label (bottle date is 07/18/2014 so its not old but it aint fresh). Taste is mostly typical wheat ale, but its surprisingly dry, with this creamy-yet-somehow-still-light mouthfeel thats really nice. Im not a huge fan of wheat beers, but this is one of the best Canadian examples Ive tried.
Aroma is sweet malts, clove, yeast. Taste is fairly bitter off the bat but finishes very smoothly. Appearance is a hazy grass/orange body with a bubbly pearl head that retains fairly well.

375ml bottle from Peluso. The beer is a psle opaque gold. It has a fantastic aroma with wheat lemon, papaya, herbal really wonderful. The taste is wheaty cloves with a solid citrus hoppiness. Probably one of the best wheat ales I've had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille de 750 ml achetée chez IGA. Couleur dorée presque ambre, avec apparence trouble. Mousse épaisse avec dentelle. Odeur de fruits, pain/blé mais surtout houblon frais. Le houblon prend aussi beaucoup de place au goût, pas assez de blé. Amertume assez forte, pas très surette. Palais sec mais enrobant. Un peu trop houblonné à mon goût mais quand même très intéressant.

Intense aroma of pepper, clove, and banana. Pours a cloudy gold color with a large lasting creamy white head. Full body, velvety feel with soft carbonation and a spicy finish of average duration. Complex taste of Belgian yeast, clove, banana and pepper.

Poured from a bottle. Murky yellow color, huge white frothy head. Sour clove aroma. Light body with an acidic clove flavor and a light flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle, production date 28th of august 2013. poured in a white wine glass. medium heavy carbonation, color is hazy golden. the frothy head stays for a little while and keeps a good lacing. aromas of fruity hops and fruity yeast, banana and papaye, wheat. a little alcohol too. in the mouth carbonation is just perfect, lots of bitterness mango and bananas, little alcohol here.mango, great bitterness in the finish. dry. a great tasty beer, refreshing

Runder hopfig bitterer Antrunk, blumig. Der Hopfen wird vollmundig, die Bitterkeit nimmt dabei ab. Angenehm fruchtig, aromatisch, deutlich hefig. Die Hefigkeit nimmt noch zu, auch der Hopfen wird noch etwas stärker. 8/11/9/11/11//11

Bottle 375ml. [ As Les Trois Mousquetaires S.S. Hopfenweisse ].Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light moderate malty, wheat, moderate hoppy, grass, fruity hops, moderate yeasty, fruity yeast, banana notes. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, sweet yeast - fruit, hoppy, fruity hops, wheat beer yeast, dry, sulfur notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140705]

Pours a hazy light yellow with lots of head and medium retention. Aroma is fruity and hoppy and reminds of a belgian twist to the hefewizen. Taste is slightly fruity and quite dry and hoppy. Aftertase is grassy but quite short. A very enjoyable hefewiezen that reminds of a hint of IPA.
Bottle. Overall nice, classified as German Hefeweizen, however reminding of a pale ale.
Hazy yellow of color with a small white head. An aroma of wheat, banana, hops and weak sour. A flavor of hops, citrus, bitter and sour.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, wheaty, banana and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. Has very little to do with a German Hefeweizen. 050714
Bottle. Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, wheat, yeast and hop. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, medium sweet, hop, dry, harsh and medium bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, yeast, wheat malt, grass and hops. Dry hoppy finish.

An outstanding beer from French Canada. Had it on tap at East of Everything, Melbourne. Amazing hop aroma and firm bitterness with the smooth texture of a classic hefeweizen. Brilliant stuff, would drink again but is probably pretty hard to come by.

Beaucoup plus intéressant que la Weizen standard. Le houblon américain ajoute au blé des arômes frais, du corps et de la complexité. Les arômes de blé et banane citronnés pourrait être un parfum dHerbal Essence :). Une finales qui donne un coup de fraicheur avant de sadoucir avec les malts du Québec. Cest bon!
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, bananig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, hopfig, bananig.

Bouteille de 750 ml achetée à lÉpicerie des Halles à St-Jean au coût de $5.99. Dégustée le 17 novembre 2012 (lager glass). Bière blonde dorée voilée. Col moyen blanc grisâtre, assez durable. Très effervescente, grosses bulles. Odeur de blé marquée. Douce, un peu sucrée, peu amère. Saveur très typique de blé, de bananes. Un peu forte pour une blanche. Devient un peu fade avec le temps, pas dépices, orange, etc. pour relever le blé.

Botella de 375ml. Vaso Weizen. intensos aromas de fruta tropical al destapar. Color oro brillante y cristalina. Espuma blanca, corona tupida y persistente que deja algo de encaje en las paredes. En nariz, aromas de contundente lúpulo, cítrico, resinas e intenso herbal con trazos de miel, el perfil queda redondeado por notas de piel de plátano y pan subyacente. La entrada vivaz queda barrida por notas cítricas y de pino. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación moderada aunque chispeante. Paladar fresco con textura de pan. En el intermedio afloran sabores afrutados  recuerdos de mango-, toque reseco y amargor que permanecen en el prolongado final dulzón. Agradables notas de madera verde en el reseco retrogusto. Agradable ligereza y textura de una Weizen pero sequedad y lupulización de una AIPA!!
375ml bottle. Weizen glass. Tropical fruit intense aromas fly at the moment cap is removed. Bright gold color, clear appearance. White froth, close & lasting crown. Some lacing is left on sides. Heavy hoppiness, citric, resins & intense herbal to the nose as well as honey hues rounded by subtle banana peel notes & underlying bread. Crispy upfront is swept out by citric & piney notes. Light body. Moderate but lively carbonation. Bready texture & fresh mouthfeel. Fruity some mango hints- flavor, dried touch & bitterness arise in the middle lingering into a long sweet finish. Nice hues of green wood on a dried aftertaste. Gentle lightness & texture as a Weizen but dried & hopped as an AIPA!!
bouteille de 750 ml de blonde. arome enivrante de papaye de banane et de sucré. en bouche on retrouve un amertume et une belle douceur également.

375ml bottle. Hazy golden colour with average to huge, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Wheaty, yeasty, fruity hoppy aroma, notes of mango, passion fruit and other tropical fruit, some herbal notes, even a smoky touch. Taste is complex and permanently changing, fruity and herbal hoppy, spicy yeasty, minimally smoky, salty, fruity notes of mango, banana, lemon. Like a light Weizenbock with a Gose on top - excellent. Could scratch perfection with a bit more fruit supporting wheat malt sweetness and a bit more body.

Bières de couleur dorée-orangés avec un beau col assez mousseux blanc. Nez dagrumes et de fruits exotique. En bouche cest un mélange qui me plait plus ou moins mais en général cest une excellente bière bien construite, Banane, agrumes,fruits exotique avec une moyenne amertume. Une bière qui nest pas dans mes cordes mais demeure excellente dans son style et son originalité!

Blonde tachetée dorange, cet amalgame germano-américain mousse abondamment, laissant une dentelle lascive qui perdure tout au long de la dégustation. Assez trouble, les deux styles de bière, Weizen et Pale Ale américaine, sont constamment en contraste, tant au niveau du nez quen bouche. Dun côté, la levure et le blé dégagent des esters de bananes et doranges sanguines, de lautre, des houblons herbacés et citronnés procurent une amertume rafraîchissante, mais un peu trop envahissante. Une sensation crémeuse enrobe le palais et adoucit un tantinet lastringence de cette bière qui est, à mon avis, sous-estimée.
Very nice beer. Great hoppy aroma.very good head retention. The tast is smooth and sweet with a wonderful bitterness. Great beer.
Mangue, banane avec un arrière goût de pamplemouse. Boire pas trop froide afin de bien goûter les subtilités

Aroma:Light apricot and banana,wheat...
Appearance:Hazy yellow,chunk of yeast,good head...
Flavor:floral,banana and tropical fruit...

Première impression, avant même de verser la bière, une sniffée au dessus de la bouteille tout juste décapsulée : Mium! Je suis pas encore assez connaisseur pour exprimer ce que ça sent exactement, mais ça sent la bière réussie! Je verse... Un peu trop carbonisée à mon goût, mais tout de même acceptable et dune belle couleur dorée. par contre au goût cest une surprise : une amertume assez présente sans toutefois le goût du houblon qui laccompagne en général! Ça goûte la bière branche, mais _amère_. Le problème cest que cette amertume semble un peu déplacée ici, à mon avis. Ce nest pas mauvais (en fait la fin de la bouteille me semble meilleure que les premières gorgées!), mais ce pas génial non plus.

75 cl bottle @ RIP camp, produced 03/2013
Aroma is rather nice with fruity notes, hops, apricot and hints of hay. Flavour is a bit messy with some gooseberry bush -like hops, apricot and some bun dough. Foamy palate. This lacks the yeasty fruitiness hefeweizens usually have. Adding the yeast makes this more mellow, not sure if it was a good move or not. More like wheat ale than hefe.

750 ml bottle @ RIP camp.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of herbs, mango, grass and strong citrusy hops. Flavour of strong citrusy hops, sweet mango, herbs, wheat, grass and spices. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and lively carbonation, at least at first. Finishes very bitter and fruity, dry and herbal. Nice one.

75 cl bottle @ RIP Camp.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, some fruits, hops, some pine needles and caramel, some toffee also. Flavor of exotic fruits, yeast, some hops, hay, banana and wheat. Nice and crisp hoppy hefe.
3435

750ml bottle @ RIP Camp

Pours hazy yellowish orange with a foamy head. Aroma of fruity hops, grass, citrus, zesty lemon, yeast and banana. Taste is fruity, yeasty and spicy with notes of banana, citrus and wheat. Finish is hoppy, juicy fruity and yeasty with notes of zesty lemon and spices. Nice, hoppy and fruity wheat ale.

Bottle, bought @ Beer City, Belgium. Pours hazy yellow with a small, creamy, off-white film head. Aroma has pepper, resin, grapefruit, wheat. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good hops, wheat, very dry and bitter, good elegance. Lovely bitterness.

Bouteille 75cl, bottled on 03/2013 partagée avec Tomaz.
Orangée sur un toruble moyen blanc fin aux bulles sporadiques.
Arôme de feuilles de thé vertes, note fruité tropicale moyenne pouvant laisser penser à la papaye. Note de grains en rétro-nasal pour une bonne note de froment.
Palais est malté assez basique, pils, cara avec un profil houblonné citronné très agréable qui ajoute complexité et profondeur à la bière. Note aussi un côté moyen de mangue pour un houblonnage qui vient ponctué un style qui se doit dêtre revisité en Allemagne. Lusage dun houblon américain est idéale et procure un changement qui fait effet. Lamertume se dissipe avec aise, le tout accompagné dun pétillant modéré.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden honey colour with a two finger off-white head. The nose is up front with spice, black pepper, yeast, rose petal, light resinous and tropical fruit, and paraffin. Medium bodied, and lightly sweet with big minerality, light banana and spicy hefe notes, light resinous hops, and yeast in the bitter finish. Kind of seems like a hefeweizen / saison hybrid. Not bad, but definitely not like other hopfenweisses Ive tried.
(bottle) clear orange yellow colour with a tall white head; aromas of tropical fruit, banana, cloves; strong and clean flavour, rather dry; with a long light bitter and dry finish

Bière jaune, orangée, dorée, voilée, bonne effervescence, surmontée dun bon col blanc mousseux, dense, qui se réduit tout de même assez rapidement. Arômes évidents dagrumes, levure et houblon citronné, léger caramel, un peu de blé, de pain, épices (coriandre surtout), herbes salés, houblon herbacé, pointe de fruits tropicaux. Arômes riches et complexes, cest très intéressant! En bouche, cest un peu pétillant, un peu mousseux, avec une onctuosité intéressante. Au goût, le houblon citronné et herbacé domine avec sa franche amertume. On retrouve également des saveurs dagrumes (oranges et pamplemousse) et un tout petit peu de fruits tropicaux, mais globalement, le goût de cette bière est beaucoup moins riche et complexe que son nez, étant presque totalement orienté vers le houblon et lamertume, et même si ce nest pas mauvais, je trouve cela personnellement un peu décevant

couleur jaune trouble.
au nez:banane et houblon....agrumes
au gout:bon mélange de blanche allemande avec ipa.
gout de blée,banane suivi de lamertume du houblon.

750ml bottle in a weizen glass.Pours a clear straw colour with a large, white, four finger head that clings to the glass. Carbonation can be seen rising to the top. Aroma has notes of spice, hops, yeast, bananas, and other fruits. Taste is a bit bitter with medium body and low carbonation. A touch syrupy in the mouth. Aftertaste is slightly dry and lingers until the next sip. Very nice beer. Well worth a try and sharing with good friends.

750ml bottle from the LCBO. hazy golden pour, big frothy white head, 
aroma of mango, pear, and pine, with touches of yeasty wheat.
the finish is quite bitter, with more yeast coming thorugh, with some great tropical fruit hops. impressive beer.

On tap @ Pub St. Andre in Montreal. Very hazy light orange with a creamy light head. Aroma is very intriguing, best described as floral and herbal, but certainly very aromatic, incredible. The palate is lovely sweet wheat with tons of aromatic hop character: fresh pineapple, orange pulp, elderflower, light earthy mint, light coriander spice. Beautiful flavours here. Outstanding!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Earthy and bold. Loads of wheat. Mild bitterness great value for a 750. I like the finish and it looks great. 750 is a lot for one person, best split 4 ways unless you really like the style

Bright gold, med white head. Aroma has spicy phenolics and grape, apple and a little cherry, which play into flavor. Some banana and clove emerges. The hops are grassy-minty with a neat herbal bite. Unusual and good.

750ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden body, medium white head with good retention. Aroma of caramel, yeast, orange marmalade, herbal hops, bitter herbs, dried apricots. Taste has a nice and unexpected bitter hops kick upfront, yeast, grains, banana, spices, honey.

though it sat in the bottle quite a while before we got to try it, it stood up well to a few months aging. the flavors were well rounded, slightly oxidized, but not too much so. solid body, reasonable hop character, north american wheat with a little heft.

375ml, 6%. Blonde jaune, trouble, très banane, citronné, ananas, fruité, mangue, fumée, menthol. Bouche: bien houblonné, épicé, muscade, cannelle, menthe, mangue, herbacé. Finale sèche. Très intéressant

It pours almost opaque ochre (very cloudy); the head is off-white and mousse-like (very effervescent). The aroma has notes of: sweet grains, mango, honey, and cantaloupe. The taste is light sour and medium bitter that finishes medium-heavy bitter; there are notes of: grapefruit-zest, fresh-grains, and mango. The palate is medium-full bodied, slightly sticky, light medium carbonation, and a long bitter finish. Overall, an interestingly hoppy take on a weisse - decent.

Pours a golden yellow with a thin fizzy heas that clings to the glass.
The aroma is tropical fruits, bit of medical herbs, maybe a touch of lemon. The flavour is pretty much a reflection of all that, the herbal notes trail off into the finish. Good stuff.

Bottle as shown. Pours a cloudy orange gold with small quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is honey yeast and spice. Thick mouthfeel with light spice, yeast, and nice lingering dry finish. Very good
Fines herbes, aneth, oignon, blé, résine, corps moelleux qui sestompe en huileux. Lamertume est docile, bien balancée, adorable liquide.

2013/06/19 - Pours a hazy straw color with thick, soapy white effervescent  head. Aroma is banana, yeast, biscuit and bubblegum. Taste starts sharp and bitter, followed by banana, bubblegum and cloves and finishes with a sweet and bitter hop aftertaste. Mouthfeel is thin to medium with a good amount of carbonation and a wet and bitter finish. Not bad, but not great.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from LCBO.  Pours slightly hazy light amber with a white head.  Aroma of banana, spice, and noble hops.  Starts bitter, moves into sweet banana/bubblegum flavours, then back to a bitter finish.

750 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a murky ochre colour with thin white cap.  Aroma is lemon, other citrus fruit, wheat and spice.  Flavour is lemon zest, tangerine, wheat malt and herbs/spice.  Lightly carbonated.  Nice.

Great fresh aroma and taste. Great banana and hop flavours. Some spiciness. Very refreshing. If you took all the greatness of an APA and a Hefeweizen and combined them in one beer, this is what you would get.

Very nice offering, from the LCBO. Aroma of tropical fruits with a flavour too match. A bit of hop/spice bite that I didnt quite like given the rest of the beers profile, but otherwise this is quite nice. Mouthfeel is a bit thin but overall this beer is pretty refreshing without sacrificing flavour. Highly drinkable.

Fresh bottle from Veux-Tu.  About 5 months old in a one-year expiry date. Very drinkable, not as good as Schneider Weisse but still very enjoyable summer beer. Lasting head, slightly hoppy aroma.  A mineral character. Carbonation right there.

750 mL bottle. Pours a hazy hay color with a foamy white head and lots of lacing.  Great aromas, fresh herbaceous oregano and mint, nice tropical fruit notes from the cascades and yeast; mango, banana. A hint of bubblegum sweetness, but still dry, a thick wheaty mouth feel with an nonabrasive yet palate coating hop bitterness. Light on the palate with full carbonation.  A tasty beer, perfect for summer.

bottle from north of the wall.  glouglouburp.  quebec.  whitewalkers.  nice enough.   doughy old somewhat vegetal wheat malts.  earthy, effervescent, banana cream pie.   not typical hefeweizen, but what can you expect from the folks that brought us howie mandel.

750 ml caged corked bottle - pours a murky light gold ale with a 3 finger meringue cap that lasts. Peppery carbonation, Aroma of spice, succulent fruit, dusty wheat flour and some grassiness.. Sharp peppery mouth feel, dry spritzy character with a moderately firm body. Big blast of sweet biscuits and fruit in the front side then more balance with herbal-spicy hops, finish goes dry and a wee bit bitter with a kiss of sweetness at the end. Good drinker.

650mL bomber from the likbo. Pours a hazy straw yellow with a massive whtie head. The effervescence is rather excessive. Aroma is banana and hand lotion. Flavour is rather unpleasant with some decent banana, clove and minor hop bite upfront met with a ton of horribly dry yeast that really feels abrasive. Not sure what happened here but I wouldnt call this a pleasant drinking experience. It really does taste like something synthetic, like hand lotion or vaseline.  Its a shame because I really like this brewery.

750 mL bottle.  Hazy, as it should be, but the colour isnt particularly appealing.  Nice head, though.  The hops in the aroma are lovely, and there is certainly much more bitterness than in the average weisse, but the hops are not as present initially in the flavour.  They increasingly made their presence known as the beer warms.  This is a solid weisse that is enhanced by the careful application of hops.  I love this style.

Pours a hazy dark gold colour with a large fluffy white head with good retention. Smells of cut grass and banana. Tastes of tropical fruit, banana, slight bitterness and nice hop profile. Was looking forward to this beer in the release and wasnt disappointed.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2013 750ml bottle from the lcbo. Pours hazed golden with a white head. Aroma of American hops and dry wheat ale. The flavour is decent, American hops clashing with some German yeast. Meh. MAYBE I WAS A LITTLE HARSH ON THIS ONE. AS IT WARMED I STARTED TO ENJOY THIS QUITE A BIT MORE. THE HOPS AND YEAST REALLY STARTED TO WORK. MAYBE THIS SHOULD BE SERVED A LITTLE WARMER THEN A TYPICAL WEISSE. I MAYBE I WAS JUST A BIT GRUMPY WHILE DOING MY ORIGINAL RATING.

Single smaller bottle from Marché Omni. Nice, a German wheat beer, but with a twist - American hops. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a big white frothy head, very long retention and foamy lacing. Fresh grassy, hoppy nose with the wheat characteristics in the background (hints of bananas). Nicely bitter, but not overly, for the taste, just coating the wheat grain flavours. Well-blended notes of grass, grapefruit, bananas, bubblegum and cereal. Quite an interesting hybrid brew.

Pours amber with a fading head.
Nose shows doughy wheat, banana, spicy cloves and phenols. Quite tempting.
Doughy wheat as a flavour too, along with soft booze, spicy hops, and herbal notes. Some sweet malt too.
Could use a bit more carbonation.

Bouteille de 375ml, 6% abv. Jai trouvé cette bière bien intéressante. Le gout dagrume,dépice se laisse savouré à lentré en bouche suivie dune bonne amertume. Un bon mélange allemand et de houblon américain!

À loeil : 
La Hopfenweisse est jaune clair, translucide et porte une mousse moyenne qui se dégrade rapidement.
Au nez : 
Cest les tropiques ! Agrumes, citron. Le nez est doux, sans pointe amère ou acide.
Au goût :
Plus près dune IPA que dune Hefeweizen. Les houblons américains prennent beaucoup de place (zeste de citron). La finale est douce, caractéristique la plus intéressante de cette bière !

Bière blanche de 6 % dalcool. À première vue, elle est blonde, mais un coût tempéré, elle devient blanche. Elle possède un odorat amer, à première idée de moufette, mais on sent légèrement un aspect sucré, type miel. Elle possède un long col mousseux, fort pétillante, et un goût très amer en bouche, du genre citron et/ou limette. Cest un goût très persistant et à la longue, fort désagréable. Pas à mon goût du tout !

375 ml. 6%. Blonde un peu orangée, trouble, avec peu de mousse. Odeur fruitée. Goute la blanche, agrumes,  avec un kick d'amertume (56 IBU).
Intéressante, mais pas assez pour me convertir aux blanches.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Jaime décrire cette bière comme un joyeux hybride entre une blanche allemande et une IPA américaine. Ici, nous avons droit aux avantages des deux styles, sans désavantage apparent; le beurre et largent du beurre! Pamplemousse frais et fruits tropicaux sur une belle finale de banane trempée dans le houblon. On se gâte, allez, une autre gorgée!

Pours hazy golden with a light orange hue and creamy white head. The aroma brings fresh straw wheat, corn, and delicious banana with a very soft juicy hop profile in the background. The flavor brings a crispy wheat malt profile with some juicy light bitter hops on the end of the palate.

Bouteille de 375 ml achetée chez La Barik (Trois-Rivières, QC). Arôme: Odeur de céréales et de bananes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe dhoublons et de bananes.. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #4492)

Une blanche avec beaucoup de mordant : agrumes piquantes, pétillance importante, très goûteuse, elle étonne. Ses saveurs tranchantes la démarquent, et sans être parfaite, elle est une bonne candidate pour surprendre ceux que les blanches laissent indifférents.

mildly hazy with a frothy white head. Huge esters of nutmeg, kitchen spices and banana and fruity  peach or apricot aroma. similar exotic flavours but with a hoppy bitter finish making this an extremely exiting beer for the style.

[4752-20120822] Tap. Mild toasted green beans and roasted smoked green peppers aroma. Hazy, orange brown body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Smoked peppery toasted grains flavour has a little lemon bitterness. Medium-full body is a little bitter. Good. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
(@ Volo, Toronto, ON)
Overheard: "In my mind, I like hookers." -- bowling?
Overheard: "Do you like Auntie Jens car?" "Yes, Auntie Jen drives fast."

Bouteille 375ml. De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (moyen de bananes et dagrumes) et moyennement épicées (poivre, léger de clou de girofle), de blé, moyen de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) aux notes florales et résineuses ainsi que des notes de pain grillé. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse et aux petites notes huileuses. Goût de levures fruitées (bananes, moyen dagrumes, faibles traces de fruits tropicaux) et moyennement épicées (poivre doux, léger de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé avec un léger goût de pain grillé. Parallèlement, lon retrouve une moyenne amertume asséchante de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) et à laquelle se se rajoute un petit caractère floral en toute fin. Post-goût moyen-long et sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux avec un goût de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes, léger zeste dagrumes) et un léger goût de blé.
Bouteille de 341ml, robe blonde opaque, arôme de levure et de grains, goût de banane et de houblons substile.
Bonne bière, bonne amertume mais bien équilibrée. Sa mousse mimpressionne. Elle est onctueuse et persistante.

Bottle shared with the wife.  Pours a hazed gold with a thin white head.  Soft spicy notes and a lot of almost vegetal wheat and herbal notes, loads of wheat.  Medium bodied, huge amounts of carbonation.  A bit of spicyness, some lemon notes, and then that faint vegetal hint from the nose that I tried to dismiss, comes back in force. Evens out a touch, but still not amazing. Bitterness on the finish, somewhat empty.  Disappointing.
Hazy blonde colour with a frothy white head. Peach, hop, wheat aroma. Spicy malt flavour with a hint of cinammon and spice. Tasty beer.

Hazy yellow with a thick foamy white head. Aroma is citrus, floral hops, yeast and bread. Flavor is similar with a pleasant hop profile, more powerfull than Schneider hopfenweisse. Floral hops, some citrus, bready notes and yeast. Body could be a little creamier. Very good beer overall, lucky to have this one as a regular.
Very tasteful german style white beer, with strong citrus and spices flavors. Sparkling and has a strong hops finale. Highly recommended if youre into more flavorful white beers.

Pours golden yellow with a slight haze and a small white ring. Aroma is wheat and sweet malts with slight hop floral. Taste is a nice wheat mouthfeel with a sharp hop bitterness and a small sweetness from the malt.

Bottle. Pours hazed golden orange with foamy white head. Aroma is loaded with orange zest, honey dew, lemon, banana and clove. Good spicy phenolic character. Flavors of banana, tropical fruit, spicy cloves, mango fruit. Good mouth feel as the crispness adds enjoyment. Great spicy phenolic finish. Nice hopping. Easily in my top 5 hefe and would be great on a hot day.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2012 August 3, 2012 - on draught at Volo.  Hazy gold with a smallish white head.  Beautiful aroma, tangy fruit, some alcohol, very yeasty and sneakily hoppy.  Taste is mostly grassy hops, fruit cocktail, a little alcohol - a little tropical and overripe, in a good way (8-).  Average body, solid carbonation, yield a medium length pungent bitter acidic finish - nice one!

UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 Pale golden pour with a thick white head, moderate haze. The aroma is a little bit spicy and slightly tropical with a bit of pine and a touch of fruit as well.   Spicy hoppiness that resemble lupulus quite a bit. Not really German in terms of wheat profile at all but there is a nice peppery character. Assertive bitterness on the finish. Pretty nice really although it could be even more tropical. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur jaune ambré touble, mousse blanche crémeuse et abondante. Arôme de girofle, de banane, légèrement métallique, herbal. Goût de girofle, de banane, avec une amertume en fin de bouche et une finale sèche. Carbonation élevée, corps moyen.

Bouteille de 750ml et 375ml. Bière blonde trouble avec une mousse blanche. Le nez est un heureux mélange de houblon et de blé. Les sous-produits de fermentations soit la banane, la gomme balloune et les épices sont bien présents. Le tout est en parfait harmonie. La bouche est tout aussi réussie, avec des bananes, des épices, des houblons et ce blé bien dosé. Un produit qui manquait au Québec.

Bottle, thank you Colin and Kendra!  Cloudy yellow, bubbly white head.  Odd aroma - wheat, yeast, canned vegetables, almost something earthy?  No idea.   Taste - much more interesting.  The soft silky body of a hefe and then tons of hops come in to the party.  The dry hopping really really lingers but seems out of tune with the beer.  The beer itself is as it describes - a hefe mixed with sharp American style citrus hops, packing serious heat!, but I am not sure if really makes for a solid beer in the end.  Still what an interesting experiment!  I love this kind of creativity.
Original, une hefeizen amère.  Belle mousse, jaune orange, la banane habituelle des hefeweizen se fait très discrète au bénéfice dune solide amertume qui reste longtemps en bouche.  Bien aimé.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2013 2013-06-01. Happier, grassier and fruitier than before. +2 overall. On cask at Benelux, Montreal
2012-10-05. Bright yellow body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma is odd, earthy grassy hop combination. 6+ Flavour is similar, fairly bitter grassy straw like hop profile, odd sort of earthy not quite smokey character. Odd. 6+ Average plus bodied palate. Okay, did not particularly care for it.  6/3/6/3/12-13 Bottle shared by DuctTape

2012-08-22. Hazy orange body, small white head and lace. 3+ Flavour is a bit odd, sweetish pale malt and wheat. Odd grainy sort of peasoup like vegetal character, light bitterness. Modest aroma is a bit odd, vegetal/pea soup, smoke? Light sweet floral comes out second, light grass. Average plus bodied palate. 3+ Really odd, will try it again if I have a chance - a sharp departure from what I expect from Trois Mousequetaires! 6/3/5/3/12 Draft at Volo, Toronto

This is a pretty nice beer. Pours cloudy straw with an initial foamy head that dissipates to a light covering. Aromas are reasonably muted, some banana and clove, lots of yeast. Reasonably big grassy hop finish. Tastes are very light sweet and lingering bitterness. Medium creamy in the mouth with some carbonation and an acidic bite.

bottle from local metro A: cloves, papaya, banana, floral  App: hazy blond small white head with good lacing. T/p: body is medium with long bitter finish. average carbonation. O: suprising sharp bitterness. Aromas are subtles but pleasing.  Is only lack fruity flavors to make it even more enjoyable, the bitterness is a little too high... and that comes from a hophead.

375 ml bottle purchased at La Saucisserie BAM in Laval (Quebec) on August 28, 2012. A little misty light blonde, medium head. Aroma of corn and exotic fruits, very sweet. Wheat mineral taste, slightly fruity, dry bitterness. Wya to dry!

Draught at Volo. Hazy yellow-gold with a small diminishing frothy white head.  Aroma of fruit and smoke foremost followed by caramel malt and spices. Flavour of caramel malt, light smoke and some fruit. Average to medium bodied. An odd beer, I didnt love it but its interesting and O.K.

-- Rated via Beer Buddy.

750ml bottle. Cloudy yellow leaning to amber pour with average head. Smells like ketchup chips and thats all I can think. Its a little grainy besides but so much ketchup chip. The same on the palate. Ketchup chips all the way. Strange but still good. A lot of sweet spice; cinnamon and nutmeg. Interesting but off the tracks a bit.

Une blonde légèrement trouble coiffée dune mince mousse durable. Des arômes de bananes, dagrumes, dherbes florales et dépices en émanent accompagnés, de ce que je ne comprenais pas, auparavant, quon puisse y détecter cette odeur, mais je sens la gomme balloune. Le goût est aigre et acide et levain refait surface avec ce type de bière. Jai limpression que cette bière sessouffle vite. Comme si si ses propriétés olfactives et gustatives disparaissent en cours de route. (296-050812)

Very good hefeweizen. Especially since its a style I sometimes have a love-hate relationship with. Pours pretty clear blond with a little cloudiness. Has a coy yeast aroma and a little hops that mixes together oddly, spicily. Taste has pretty high carbonation for a hefe and a big bitterness that takes over from the initial soft yeast and wheat. Bottle from Peluso.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2015 My Bottom Line :  
Citrusy hop resins and subtle banana esters reach creamed corn allusions in this polished, but overly eclectic brew.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A rich head of foam stays atop the hazy blond.
-Hop bitterness is very intense, which decreases drinkability. 
-The Weizen yeast is not prominent enough for my tastes in the style.
-The creamed corn component is disturbing once your nostrils have latched on to it. As these guys always brew clean beers, Im going to say this oddness is a contribution of Frontenac wheat malts...
-Mouthfeel is prickly yet a bit sugary.
-The flavor profile lacks softness.

Bottles.

Cloudy yellow pour with a thin white head. Pleasant aroma of banana, herbal hops, tropical fruits and bubble-gum. Very good flavor of bananas, tropical fruits, herbal hops and mild bubble-gum with a moderate bitter finish. The body is light to medium with an oily texture and lively carbonation. Good stuff!

En bouteille de 375 ml. Servie dans un verre allemand de style weizen. Belle blonde légèrement voilée, une mousse peu dense , mais tenant assez bien. Arôme de blé, dagrume, de mangue et de banane. Nous relevons quelques trace de levure. Elle dégage une bonne effervesence; au palais, elle est très pétillante et elle attaque le bout de notre langue. En bouche, la bière a un goût acidulé en première phase suivit dun goût fruité, dune légère amertume; elle ne laisse aucun arrière-goût en final. Comme suggéré sur létiquette, nous avons essayés cette bière avec des sushis; ce qui crée une harmonie parfaite avec ceux contenant des fruits (avocats, mangues, etc.).  Une valeur sûre pour les amateurs de bière allemande, mais plus houblonnée que la moyenne. Bref une très bonne bière dété.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2013 pours hazy golden with a nice white head, nice retention and lacing. herbs, wheat, coriander, tropical fruits, pepper, light phenols. average carbonation, medium body, very nice balanced citrusy-tropical finish. lives up to its name.

375ml bottle from Monde des Bières.
Appearance : Slightly hazy blond with big foamy white head. Nice lacing. Nice look overall.

Aroma : Herbal and floral hops with wheat and light yeasty notes. Very light bananas. Some fruity notes as well.

Taste : Wheat with bitter hops. Herbal and floral. Light yeast. Finish bitter with wheat and floral notes. Light fruits.

Overall : Interesting. Fairly drinkable and refreshing. Nice hops. Yeast could be a bit more present IMHO. Still quite well made and rather elefant. Nice balance between the hopfen and the weisse. Awesome bottle, I really like the new look.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 Bouteille 375 ml. 6%. Couleur jaune or claire, mousse blanche. Arôme de levure prononcé, bananes, agrumes et un peu de houblon. En bouche, agrumes, bananes, poires, blé et vers la fin , herbes et amertume agréable, prononcée pour une hefeweizen. Finale amère et fruitée. Exactement un hybride entre blanche allemande et pale ale américaine.

Bottle (375 ml). Hazy golden with a big fully diminishing white head and some lacing. Aroma of banana, wheat, spices, citrus and herbal notes. Taste is herbal with spices and citrus. Slight refreshing acidity. Medium bitterness. Good refreshing hefeweizen.

375 ml bottle. Pours a hazy coppery white with a nice white head. Smells of citrus, mostly limes and lemon. Tastes like apple, bananas, tropical fruits, wheat, cereals. Very sharp herbal and citrusy bitterness in the finish. Medium to full bodied, velvety mouthfeel. Solid wheat beer, quite refreshing!

Bottle 375ml.
Pours blond with high creamy white head, diminishing. Good lacing. Aroma is of bananas, yeast, spices, wheat, fruits. Taste is of bananas, citrus, spices, wheat. Surprising biterness. Overall: Interesting body. Refreshing. Bitter finish. Very nice balance. At first I wasnt convinced bout that hop thing, but I got to say its pretty good.

Bottle - 375ml. Hazy blond body with an average white frothy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with coriander, malty, and biscuity hints. Its surprisingly sharp taste carries coriander and citrusy notes. Ends with a long, strong, dry bitter/herbal finish. Interesting.

Belle bière trouble, dun dorée profond et coiffée dun mousseux col blanc.  Des arômes au profil de lannedale, baumier en moins.  Très amère, avec une certaine minéralité.  De corps solide, elle est bien lisse, et laisse en bouche une finale sèche, aromatique et bien amère.

Pours a lightly hazed straw hue with a prominent and foamy white head.  Aroma is yeasty and a touch musty, along with banana and muted citrus notes.  A pleasant hop bitterness up front in the flavor is quickly curbed by the yeast profile, and makes way for the typical weizen character to develop into the finish; plenty of banana and clove alongside a lingering grassiness.  Light and effervescent, a refreshing brew for a warm summer day.

Aroma: Very complex; banana, spices, clove, pepper, with a surprising meat, even smoke meat note...or is it pepperoni?
Appearance: Lightly cloudy straw color with generous and long lasting head.
Attack is hoppy with grass notes. Accents are banana, spices and pepper that do last long. A good balance of sweetness and bitterness. Texture is thin, finish is dry and bitterness is long lasting. It is indeed an interesting style and beer with a lot of potential.

Une belle blonde aux yeux embués qui présente une coiffe fuyante.  Un nez qui est fait de notes de blé grillé et de parfums dherbes habilement enlacés par des pointes de banane et des notes citronnées.  Une belle rencontre entre la levure et les cultivars.    Une bouche bien aiguisée par des houblons vigoureux et justement traversée par des flaveurs de blé.  Un autre concerto fruité: une touche citronnée (et plus largement de fruits tropicaux) des houblons et une levure qui affiche un sourire de banane.  En bouche, la sensation dun corps élancé par le mouvement de ses bulles et arrondi par la capacité de ses saveurs.  En finale, le souffle sensuellement chaud dune Allemande et la force érotique dune Américaine.  Décidément, avec ma bouche, un ménage à trois qui est tout à fait charmant.

Sample at Festibiere. 27MA12. 
App.:  Extremely murky (milky) bright golden with a creamy white head.
  
Aroma:  nice Weissebier character, limited esters/phenols, fair grassy hops, a little dirty, lots of toasted wheat, fair.
  
Palate:  Medium body, creamy effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Light esters/phenols, peppery hops, grassiness, a little wheat, sorta dirty, not entirely coherent; dry with good bitterness and a decent somewhat estery, grassy, peppery finish.

Not great and doesnt meet expectations conjured up by the name.

Draft: Poured a dirty beige/yellow color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma consists of banana ester with rich wheat malt notes and light citrus hoppy notes. Taste is a wonderful mix between some citrus hoppy notes which are well balanced against some wheat malt with light banana ester. Body was pretty full for style with good carbonation. This was a great drink and something the brewery should consider bottling.

A hazed blonde with a thin white head. In aroma, pleasant fruity banana malt with nice herbaceous hops, pungent and smooth. In mouth, a nice fruity ester with banana, grassy herbal hops, light citrus notes, very pleasing. On tap at Festibiere de Gatineau, May 25 2012.
